As a pot of tea cools, the temperature of the tea is modeled by a differentiable function H for 0 ≤ t ≤ 10, where time t is measured in minutes and temperature H(t) is measured in degrees Celsius. Values of H(t) at selected values of time t are shown in the table above.

(a) Use the data in the table to approximate the rate at which the temperature of the tea is changing at time t = 3.5. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

As a pot of tea cools, the temperature of the tea is modeled by a differentiable function H for 0 ≤ t ≤ 10, where time t is measured in minutes and temperature H(t) is measured in degrees Celsius. Values of H(t) at selected values of time t are shown in the table above.

(a) Use the data in the table to approximate the rate at which the temperature of the tea is changing at time t = 3.5. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(b) Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>H</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4230@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of this problem. Use a trapezoidal sum with the four subintervals indicated by the table to estimate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4230@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(c) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>10</mn></mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>H</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaace WGibGbauaacaGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcacaqGGaGaamizaiaadshaaSqa aiaaicdaaeaacaaIXaGaaGimaaqdcqGHRiI8aaaa@3FFE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of the expression in the context of this problem.

(d) At time t = 0, biscuits with temperature 100°C were removed from an oven. The temperature of the biscuits at time t is modeled by a differentiable function B for which it is known that B'(t) = -13.84e-0.173t. Using the given models, at time t = 10, how much cooler are the biscuits than the tea?

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
